item.title: [SHARDFI] Executive Chairman of Eco Hotels and Resorts Ltd, Vinod Kumar Tripathi, Acquires 0.21% Shares
item.description:
According to a disclosure under Regulation 29(2) of SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares & Takeovers) Regulations, 2011, Vinod Kumar Tripathi, Executive Chairman and Whole-Time Director of Eco Hotels and Resorts Limited, has purchased 1,34,799 Equity Shares of the company on February 09, 2026. This acquisition represents 0.21% of the total equity shares and voting rights of the company. The shares were acquired from the open market. Before the acquisition, Tripathi held 2362538 fully paid Equity Shares and 333098 partly paid Rights Issue Equity Shares. After the acquisition, his total holding increased to 2497337 fully paid Equity Shares and 333098 partly paid Rights Issue Equity Shares, representing 4.33% of the total equity shares and voting rights.

item.title: [TRU] TruCap Finance: Open Offer by Marwadi Chandarana Intermediaries Brokers Private Limited Terminated, SEBI Rejects Withdrawal Request
item.description:
Sundae Capital Advisors Pvt Ltd, the Manager to the Offer, has informed BSE about the termination of a Share Purchase Agreement (SPA) and a Securities Subscription Agreement (SSA) by Marwadi Chandarana Intermediaries Brokers Private Limited (Acquirer). The SPA was for the acquisition of 3,68,00,220 equity shares of the Target Company from the promoter and promoter group, and the SSA was for the subscription of 11,56,80,000 equity shares and 9,37,00,000 convertible warrants of the Target Company by the Acquirer. The Acquirer had requested SEBI to allow withdrawal of the Offer, but SEBI did not accede to the request. The Observations were issued by SEBI on the Draft Letter of Offer dated January 30, 2026. The Acquirer has filed an appeal with the Honâ€™ble Securities Appellate Tribunal (Honâ€™ble SAT), with a hearing fixed on February 11, 2026. No stay has been granted on the Offer proceedings as of the date of this intimation. If a stay is granted or there are any changes in the Offer process, schedule, or obligations, appropriate disclosures will be made in accordance with applicable law.

  • Open Offer terminated by Marwadi Chandarana Intermediaries Brokers Private Limited
  • SEBI rejects Acquirer's request to withdraw the Offer
  • Acquirer files appeal with Honâ€™ble Securities Appellate Tribunal
  • No stay granted on the Offer proceedings as of the date of this intimation

item.title: [AJANTPHARM] Ajanta Pharma Denies Rumors of Diversification into Restaurant Business
item.description:
Ajanta Pharma Ltd has clarified a news article published in The Economic Times dated February 10, 2026, and ET Online, stating that a section of the promoter group of Ajanta is independently acquiring Restaurant Brands Asia. Ajanta Pharma Limited and its Management are not parties to, and are in no manner involved in, any transaction referred to in the said news article. The Company has denied the rumors and speculation circulating in this regard.

item.title: [GPIL] Godawari Power and Ispat Ltd Receives Consent to Operate Expanded Ari Dongri Iron Ore Mines
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Godawari Power and Ispat Ltd has announced the receipt of consent to operate the Ari Dongri Iron Ore Mines at an expanded capacity. The company received the consent from the Chhattisgarh Environment Conservation Board on 09.02.2026, following the receipt of Environmental Clearance from the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change on 31.01.2026. The expansion increases the capacity from 2.35 MTPA to 6 MTPA and the mining lease area from 138.96 Ha to 213.01 Ha. The mining operations at the enhanced capacity have commenced from 10.02.2026.

item.title: [NUVAMA] Nuvama Wealth Management Ltd. to Present at Nuvama India Conference 2026: Financialization of Household Savings a Key Focus
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Nuvama Wealth Management Ltd. will participate in the Nuvama India Conference 2026 on February 10, 2026, at the Grand Hyatt, Mumbai. The presentation will be delivered by Mr. Ashish Kehair, MD and CEO, Nuvama Group. The presentation will focus on the evolution of the wealth management ecosystem, with a particular emphasis on the financialization of household savings. This shift from physical to financial to investment assets has been driven by growing affluence and a rising share of financial assets in household balance sheets. Investment assets have grown by 2.5x in the last two years, with consistent quarter-over-quarter growth for the last 12 quarters. Monthly SIP flows have also increased significantly, now at ~30K, contributing 15% to the FY25 flows.

item.title: [JSWSTEEL] JSW Steel Reports Consolidated Crude Steel Production of 24.75 Lakh Tonnes for January 2026
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

JSW Steel, a leading integrated steel company, reported consolidated Crude Steel production for January 2026 at 24.75 Lakh tonnes. The Crude Steel production at Indian operations level was marginally higher YoY. However, the capacity utilisation at Indian operations was affected due to the shutdown of Blast Furnace 3 (BF3) at Vijayanagar for upgradation. Production at USA Ohio operations was also lower due to scheduled outage for caster upgrades. JSW Steel's next phase of growth will take consolidated capacity to 48.9 MTPA over the next four years.

  • JSW Steel reported consolidated Crude Steel production of 24.75 Lakh tonnes for January 2026
  • Indian operations' production was marginally higher YoY
  • BF3 at Vijayanagar is under shutdown for upgradation, affecting capacity utilisation
  • Production at USA Ohio operations was lower due to scheduled outage for caster upgrades

Satin Finserv Limited (SFL), a wholly owned subsidiary of Satin Creditcare Network Limited, has successfully raised Rs. 50 crores in Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) with a unique per-debenture face value of Rs. 10,000. This follows shareholder approval at the EGM for enhancing the NCD issuance limit to an aggregate outstanding of Rs. 600 crores. In the last 3 months, SFL has mobilized approximately Rs. 260 crores, marking its strongest fundraising performance. This momentum in fundraising reaffirms the market's confidence in SFLâ€™s financial strength, strategy, and forward-looking growth plans. The funds will enhance SFL's visibility in the retail debt market, diversify its lender base and borrowing instruments, and build a resilient funding ecosystem. SFL maintains a solid foundation for sustained expansion and stability with sufficient liquidity and a strong Capital Adequacy Ratio of 36.1% as on December 2025. The company is advancing its growth strategy by expanding its product range to tap India's thriving MSME financing market, placing strategic emphasis on sustainability financing solutions that support the low-carbon economy transition.
